question: What is diginu?
answer: diginu is an online food delivery app that not only has much cheaper rates but also offers you the opportunity to earn recurring commissions.

question: How do I earn with diginu?
aliases: how can i earn with diginu?
answer: You can earn a few ways with diginu. You can earn from our delivery side (customers and merchants), our rewards programme (diginuCashBack) and our electric bikes (diginuEgo).

question: What is diginuCashBack?
answer: diginuCashBack is our rewards programme, where you can save every day as well as create an income every time the people that you referred pay their membership.

question: Can someone be moved if they signed up wrong?
aliases: what if they register under wrong person
answer: If someone registered under another person they cannot be moved (we have a 'registered for life' policy). If they accidentally registered under the company, you can email enrollerchange@diginu.com to request a move, but it must be within 7 days of that person registering.

question: How do I cancel my diginuCashBack debit order?
aliases: Remove My Banking Details From Diginucashback
how do i cancel cashback debit order
how do i remove my bank details from diginu
how do i stop diginucashback payment
answer: To cancel your diginuCashBack debit order and remove your banking details, you must email cashback@diginu.com . This cannot be done in your profile or app settings â€” all cancellations are processed by our support team via email. Be sure to include your full name, ID number, and registered phone number in your email so they can locate your account.

question: What is diginuEgo?
aliases: tell me about the diginuEgo bike
answer: diginuEgo is an AI-powered electric motorbike designed for modern mobility in Africa. It pairs smart security and live tracking with practical daily performance, making it ideal for commuting, delivery work, and fleet use. Electric, mid-drive motor Live tracking dashboard Remote power-off (anti-theft) Swappable lithium-ion batteries Fleet management ready Itâ€™s built for reliability, affordability and real-world convenience.

question: What are the key features of diginuEgo?
aliases: What Makes The Ego Bike Special
answer: AI & Telematics: live tracking dashboard for visibility and control Remote Power-Off: disable the bike remotely if stolen Swappable Batteries: keep riding by swapping packs (no long downtime) Strong Braking: front & rear disc brakes (240mm) Comfort & Handling: upside-down front fork + rear monoshock Built for Work: fleet management functionality Everyday Practicality: suitable for commuting, school or work

question: What are the technical specifications of diginuEgo?
aliases: what are the specs of the ego bike
answer: Brakes: front & rear disc brakes (240mm) Front Suspension: upside-down (inverted) telescopic fork Rear Suspension: monoshock Wheelbase: 1350 mm Seat Height: 815 mm (rider) Carrying Capacity: up to 150 kg Motor: mid-drive, 3000 W Battery: lithium-ion, swappable Pack Voltage: 65â€“72 V Energy: ~4.3 kWh

question: What is the battery, range and charging time for diginuEgo?
aliases: How Long To Charge Ego Bike
What is the battery range and charging time for diginuEgo
answer: Battery: lithium-ion, swappable packs Charging: ~80% in Range (Eco): ~105â€“120 km* Range (Normal): ~75â€“90 km* Range (Sport): ~65â€“70 km* *Actual range varies with load, terrain and riding style.

question: How much does the diginuEgo cost?
aliases: what is the price of the ego bike
answer: The diginuEgo bike is priced at R89,900 (incl. VAT) . Licensing and admin fees are excluded. Interested in ordering or a quote? Contact us and weâ€™ll assist.

question: Does the diginuEgo have anti-theft and tracking?
aliases: Can Ego Be Disabled If Stolen
Does the diginuEgo have antitheft and tracking
answer: Remote power-off: disable the bike over the internet if stolen Live tracking dashboard: monitor location and status in real-time Fleet visibility: centralised oversight for multiple bikes These features are part of diginuâ€™s focus on secure, reliable mobility.

question: Where can I see diginuEgo videos and demos?

question: Is the diginuEgo good for delivery riders and commuting?
aliases: Ego Bike For School Or Work
Is The Ego Practical For Commuting
answer: Yes. diginuEgo is designed for daily use with low running costs and minimal downtime thanks to swappable batteries . The suspension, braking and mid-drive configuration support predictable handling in urban traffic. For delivery teams, live tracking and remote control improve safety and operational oversight.

question: Does the diginuEgo support fleet management?
aliases: does ego integrate with fleet tools
answer: Yes. The platform includes fleet management functionality with a live dashboard for location, usage and control. This helps teams optimise deployment, monitor security, and reduce downtime.

question: Are there plans for battery swapping or charging stations?
aliases: When Will Ego Have Battery Swap Stations
answer: Yes. From 2026 , diginu plans to roll out battery swapping and charging stations across the country, with solar and wind generation at many sites. This supports faster turnarounds and lower operating costs for riders and fleets.

question: How do I withdraw cash from my diginuPay wallet?
aliases: how to cash out from diginuPay
where can i withdraw diginupay money
answer: You can withdraw cash from your diginuPay wallet using a cashout voucher sent to your phone. Hereâ€™s how it works: Open your diginuPay app and request a cash withdrawal You will receive an SMS with a Nedbank MobiMoney voucher code Go to any supported store or ATM and use the voucher to withdraw cash Where you can withdraw: Nedbank ATMs Checkers, Shoprite, Pick n Pay, OK, Usave, Boxer & House and Home Kazang partner stores nationwide diginuPay is integrated with Nedbank MobiMoney , giving you thousands of withdrawal locations across South Africa for easy access.

question: Can I transfer money wallet-to-wallet on diginuPay?

send money to another diginupay user
answer: Yes, you can make instant wallet-to-wallet transfers to any diginuPay user. Open the app â†’ Transfer â†’ select/browse recipient Confirm amount and reference Recipient is notified instantly Security note: Only send to people you trust and double-check the recipient details before confirming.

question: How do I transfer money from diginuPay to my bank account?
answer: You can transfer to a South African bank account from within the app. Add or select your bank beneficiary Enter amount and confirm Processing times vary by bank and method Security note: For your protection, diginuPay may verify your identity before enabling bank transfers. Need assistance? wecare@diginu.com

question: How do I receive money in my diginuPay wallet?
aliases: How Can Someone Send Me Money
answer: There are a few ways to receive money: Another user sends you a wallet-to-wallet transfer You receive funds from a merchant payout or commission You deposit using any available top-up method in the app Youâ€™ll get a notification when funds land.

question: Which banks and cards are supported by diginuPay?
aliases: Can I Use Nedbank Capitec Fnb

answer: diginuPay works with major South African banks for transfers and voucher cashouts via Nedbank MobiMoney . Card support and methods may vary by feature. Withdrawals: Nedbank ATMs and partner retailers via voucher Transfers: to SA bank accounts (processing times may vary) Cards/Instant EFT: availability shown in app during checkout Check your app for the latest supported options.

question: I didnâ€™t receive my voucher SMS â€” what should I do?
aliases: I didnt receive my voucher SMS what should I do
answer: If your Nedbank MobiMoney voucher SMS hasnâ€™t arrived: Confirm your phone has signal and isnâ€™t in Do Not Disturb Check your number in Profile is correct Wait a few minutes and try resend if available If still missing, cancel and generate a new voucher Note: Some networks can delay SMS delivery. If it persists, contact us with your attempted time and amount. Support: wecare@diginu.com

question: My voucher expired â€” can I still withdraw?
aliases: My voucher expired can I still withdraw
answer: Expired vouchers canâ€™t be redeemed. Simply generate a new voucher in the app and use it at an eligible ATM or retailer. Check the validity window when you create the voucher Only share codes with trusted cashiers If youâ€™re unsure whether a voucher was used, contact support and weâ€™ll help trace it.

question: My cash withdrawal failed â€” how do I fix it?
aliases: My cash withdrawal failed how do I fix it
answer: Try these steps: Confirm the voucher code matches your SMS Use a listed Nedbank ATM or supported retailer Check youâ€™re selecting Nedbank MobiMoney at the till/ATM Ensure youâ€™re within the voucherâ€™s validity and your daily limit If it still fails, note the time, store/ATM, and error message, then contact us. Support: wecare@diginu.com

question: How do I update my bank details in diginuPay?
answer: You can update your payout/bank details from your profile or payments section in the app. Open Profile â†’ Bank details Edit account name/number/branch Save and verify if prompted Security note: For your protection, we may request ID verification when changing bank details.

question: How do I add or link a bank account to diginuPay?
answer: To link a bank account for payouts: Go to Profile â†’ Bank details Enter your bank, account number and branch info Save and complete any verification steps Once linked, you can transfer from your wallet to your bank.

question: How do I deposit money into my diginuPay wallet?
answer: Open your app and choose a top-up option available to you. Methods may include card, EFT, or other providers displayed in-app. Choose your method and amount Follow the prompts to complete payment Weâ€™ll notify you when funds arrive Note: Processing times vary by method.

question: Why is my payment pending in diginuPay?
aliases: Why Is My Transaction Still Pending
answer: Pending means your payment is still being processed by the bank or provider. This is normal for EFT and some card methods. Most pendings resolve automatically Times vary by bank/weekend/public holidays If it exceeds the usual window, contact support with your reference

question: How do reversals and refunds work on diginuPay?
answer: Refunds and reversals depend on the original payment method and provider rules. In-app transfers are usually final Card/EFT payments may require a provider dispute Weâ€™ll help investigate if funds didnâ€™t arrive or were duplicated Start by sharing the date, amount and reference with support. Contact: wecare@diginu.com

question: Why is my diginuPay account locked or flagged?
answer: Accounts can be temporarily restricted for security or compliance reasons (e.g., unusual activity, incorrect details, or pending KYC checks). Check your email/app notifications for instructions Complete any requested ID verification Contact support if you need help resolving it These checks help keep your money safe and prevent fraud.

question: What is the difference between a merchant and a merchant marketer?
answer: A merchant is a business (e.g., restaurant, grocery store, liquor store) that sells on the Diginu app. A merchant marketer is an accredited Diginu partner who onboards merchants to the platform and earns ongoing commission from customer orders placed at the live merchants in their portfolio.
followups: What is a merchant on Diginu?
What is a merchant marketer on Diginu?

question: What is a merchant on Diginu?
answer: A merchant is a business that lists products or services on the Diginu marketplace, receives orders from customers, and fulfills those orders via pickup or delivery. Examples include restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores, bakeries, and specialty retailers.
followups: How do I become a merchant on Diginu?
Is there a fee to join as a merchant?

question: What is a merchant marketer on Diginu?
answer: A merchant marketer is an individual who has completed Diginuâ€™s accreditation course and is authorized to onboard merchants to the platform. They build a portfolio of merchants and earn commission from every order placed by customers at those live merchants.
followups: How do I become a merchant marketer?

question: How do merchant marketers earn commission?
answer: Merchant marketers earn commission on every order placed through the Diginu app across all live merchants in their personal portfolio. Earnings grow as your portfolio expands and your merchants succeed.
followups: How much commission can I earn?
When and how are commissions paid?

question: What is a merchant portfolio?
answer: Your merchant portfolio is the list of merchants you personally onboarded to Diginu. Commissions are calculated from orders generated by all live merchants in this portfolio.
followups: How many merchants can I onboard?
Can I track my portfolio performance?

question: Who can become a merchant marketer?
answer: Anyone who completes the Diginu Merchant Marketer Accreditation Course and agrees to our partner guidelines can become a merchant marketer. A passion for business development and local commerce helps.
followups: Is there an age or location requirement?

question: Is there a cost to become a merchant marketer?
answer: Accreditation requirements and any associated fees are communicated during enrollment. We keep entry barriers low and focus on equipping you to succeed with real merchants.

question: How long does accreditation take?
answer: Most candidates complete the Diginu accreditation course quickly. The timeline depends on your paceâ€”plan for focused learning, a short assessment, and onboarding to our tools.
followups: How do I schedule my assessment?

question: Is the merchant marketer role full-time or part-time?
answer: Itâ€™s flexible. Many start part-time and scale up as their merchant portfolio grows. Your income can expand with the number and performance of your live merchants.
followups: How many hours should I plan weekly?
Can I do this alongside my job?
aliases: Is the merchant marketer role fulltime or parttime

question: Do merchant marketers get support and tools?
answer: Yes. Accredited marketers receive onboarding resources, outreach templates, a referral/onboarding flow, and access to performance insights to help grow and support their merchant portfolio.
followups: Is there a community or mentorship?

question: Can merchant marketers onboard merchants in any location?
answer: You should focus on regions where Diginu is active or launching. Weâ€™ll guide you on supported areas and expansion plans so your efforts translate into live, earning merchants.
followups: How do I check supported areas?
Can I request a new area launch?

question: Do merchant marketers need sales experience?
answer: Sales experience helps but isnâ€™t required. We provide a practical framework: how to find prospects, present Diginu, handle objections, and get merchants live quickly.

question: What is the benefit of becoming a merchant marketer?
answer: You create value for local businesses, help them grow via the Diginu app, and earn ongoing commissions from customer orders. Itâ€™s a scalable, impact-driven opportunity.
followups: What results do top performers see?

question: Can merchant marketers build teams?
answer: Your primary focus is onboarding your own merchants. Where applicable, we may pilot programs that recognize collaboration. Weâ€™ll share details if a team pathway is available in your region.

question: What products do merchants sell on Diginu?
answer: Common categories include prepared food, groceries, liquor, and specialty goods. Availability varies by merchant and region, and merchants manage their own menus and inventory.
followups: How are menus and prices updated?

question: How do I become a merchant on Diginu?
answer: Share your business details, catalog, and fulfillment preferences, then complete onboarding so we can activate your store on the app. A merchant marketer can guide you end-to-end.

question: How do I become a merchant marketer?
answer: Apply for the Diginu Merchant Marketer Accreditation, complete the course and assessment, accept our partner terms, and youâ€™ll receive access to onboarding tools and your performance dashboard.

question: How much commission can I earn as a merchant marketer?
answer: Your earnings depend on the number of live merchants in your portfolio and their order volumes. We publish commission structures separately and keep them simple and transparent.

question: When and how are commissions paid?
answer: Commissions are paid on a regular cycle after order activity is reconciled. Youâ€™ll receive statements and have visibility into order-level performance for your portfolio.
followups: Is there a minimum payout threshold?

question: Is there a contract or NDA for merchant marketers?
answer: Accredited marketers accept Diginuâ€™s partner terms, which cover brand use, data handling, and compliance. Additional agreements may apply depending on region and program.
followups: Do I need an NDA with merchants?

question: What support do merchants receive after going live?
answer: Merchants get access to menu management, order tools, and support resources. Merchant marketers can help with launch readiness, menu updates, and best practices to drive orders.
